H0.text: Radioactivity is the term for the ability of an atom to emit, or give off, charged particles and energy from its nucleus.

H1.text: Magnetism is the term for the ability of an atom to emit, or give off, charged particles and energy from its nucleus.

H2.text: Electrical attraction is the term for the ability of an atom to emit, or give off, charged particles and energy from its nucleus.

H3.text: Conductivity is the term for the ability of an atom to emit, or give off, charged particles and energy from its nucleus.

A4.text: Radioactive decay (also known as nuclear decay, radioactivity, radioactive disintegration, or nuclear disintegration) is the process by which an unstable atomic nucleus loses energy by radiation.

A5.text: Three of the most common types of decay are alpha, beta, and gamma decay.
